summary: The bill, titled the Captivity of Helpless Elephants Reduction Act of 2025 (CHER Act), aims to amend the Animal Welfare Act to prohibit the display, husbandry, and breeding of African and Asian elephants in zoological and safari parks. It mandates the transfer of existing elephants to authorized wildlife sanctuaries within three years of enactment. The bill also includes provisions for a feasibility study, a grant program to support wildlife sanctuaries, and public education on the welfare benefits of the ban.
